direction.raw_text: Story by Pen Densham Screenplay by John Watson & Pen Densham
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INC. Burbank, California 91522               All Rights Reserved
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says you stole his bread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a lie. I caught him stealing ours. The lowlife jabbers some more.    The Interrogator debates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut off the infidel's hand. The jailers haul Peter to the chopping block. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!... I took the bread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're not interested in truth. You are too weak, Peter. You would not live through it. The Interrogator stares into Robin's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sacrifice for the weaker? How noble... As you wish... Cut off this one's hand as well!... But first... He indicates an Arab prisoner, who is dragged forward. His struggling hand is laid on the executioner's block.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show them the courage of Allah. The prisoner's face braces for the pain. A red-hot scimitar flashes down. The hand flips into a basket. Twitching. Robin is next. His composure fails. He flops to his knees, crying. The Interrogator laughs. The jailers unlash the thongs on Robin's hand. They stretch it out, forcing it down. Robin goes limp, sobbing. Peter catches his eye... Robin winks. The scimitar. Drawn from the coals. Spitting flame. Arcs down. Robin is suddenly galvanized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this is English courage. He hurls his holders aside. Swings upward, driving his fast into the executioner's throat. Grabs the sword. Slash. His thongs melt like butter. A jailer leaps at him. Steaming, the scimitar slices into the man's chest. Despite his bindings, Peter wrestles the Interrogator. Knife pressed to his throat, Peter is forced against the furnace. At the last second, he flips the man into the fire. Screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's for five years of hell. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: A jailer aims a scalding blade at Robin's back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind you! Warned, Robin ducks away.    Slams the jailer's head into the wall. Peter frees himself, but they are still outnumbered. While fighting, Robin acknowledges the man who shouted the warning. An imposing, shaven-headed SARACEN. Heavily-muscled arms and chest, covered in tattoos. Even his bald head is ornamented.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You speak English?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The king's own. Set me free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Robin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For pity's sake. Mine is a sentence of death. Robin sidesteps, propelling a guard into a pit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't trust him. Two more guards attack, yelling fury.    Robin eyes the curved scimitar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I would give for an English sword. This is a pruning hook. A guard swings at him with a giant axe.    Robin slashes... shears the axe handle in two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm!   Not bad. He runs the man through. Peter loses his sword. His opponent moves in for the kill... Peter grabs tongs from the fire and smolders his opponent with a backhand. Commotion outside.    RAISED VOICES and RUNNING FEET.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Free me and I will show you a way out. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why should we trust you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you don't, you are dead men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He makes a point. The door bursts open.    More guards rush in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A good point. He slashes the man free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever blood is in his veins, he does not deserve to die here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way! He beckons them to the back.     A hidden door leads into a tunnel. INT. SEWERS - NIGHT They wade through foul water up to their waists. The Saracen leads... A snake lashes out for his face. Robin lops off its head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are fast, my friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five years I've waited for the smell of free air. That makes a man fast. Guards drop down from above, carrying torches.    Blocking the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will need to be yet faster. A narrow opening to their left... they splash through. Half running, half crawling in the dank water. Fire arrows land around them. The orange smoke is choking. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poison air.   Hold your breath. Flames illuminate the walls, alive with a loathsome mass of crawling slime. Peter falls. A pursuer descends on him, thrusting a blazing torch at his face. The Saracen intercepts the blow. Grabs the man's neck, SNAPPING it with one mighty twist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (coughing) Thanks. I misjudged you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Save your breath. Gasping for air, they find the tunnel veers steeply down- ward. A slippery, granite tube. Losing purchase, they slide headlong. Sharp, rusted spikes jut out from the walls ahead. Robin grabs at the walls to break the fall. No use. They're picking up speed. He turns his sword crossways, bracing it against the sides of the tunnel, as a brake. Sparks fly. The sword cuts into Robin's chest... but it works.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allah be praised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amen, brother. A bloodcurdling scream. A pursuing guard tumbles down the sewer chute. The three men press themselves against the wall. The man hurtles by... is impaled on the spikes. A draft of fresh air from the roof of the tunnel. Using the spiked guard as a ladder, Robin climbs. Removes a grating. EXT. ARAB STREET - NIGHT Robin's head appears... ducks back down, as a squad of mounted soldiers thunders right over him... he reappears. All clear. They're outside the prison wall. Robin helps Peter up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God willing, we may now be safe. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Swoosh. An arrow pierces through Peter's chest -- fired from the prison wall. He reels... Robin leads him under the wall for protection. Shouts of alarm. Soldiers approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, Peter.    We must hurry. Raising his sword, Peter faces the oncoming soldiers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is mortal.    Leave me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on to my shoulder. Peter shakes him off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mother... my little sister. Tell them I love them. Tell them I died a free Englishman. Robin looks despairingly to the Saracen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His wound is by the heart.    We cannot save him. Robin knows it's true. Peter pulls an insignia ring from a hidden pouch in his clothes. Thrusts it into Robin's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take this to my sister. Swear you will protect her for me... Swear it, Robin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reluctantly) I swear it. Summoning hidden resources of strength, Peter charges at the oncoming soldiers, brandishing his sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For England. He fells the first Arab.   The Saracen pulls Robin away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come now! Do not fail your friend. Make his sacrifice an act of honor. They vanish into the night. Fighting like a man pos- sessed, Peter is swallowed in a sea of enemy soldiers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DESERTED ALLEY - LATER Robin and the Saracen catch their breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Farewell, friend. God speed you on your way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our way is together. With the speed of Allah. He grins.    This strange man has a sense of humor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I go to England.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I go to England.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: England?   Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saved my life. I must stay with you until I save yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go your own way. I relieve you of your obligation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only Allah can do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if I don't want you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have no choice... unless you think you can kill me. He grins broadly.      Offers his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Aslan. Resigned, Robin takes the proferred hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robin of Locksley. You know a short route to England, Aslan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. LOCKSLEY CASTLE (NOTTINGHAMSHIRE, ENGLAND) Eerie shapes. Weaving. White light on water. The moon reflected in the moat of a small castle. Towers shrouded in night mist. Smoke curls from a chimney. SUPERIMPOSE:   LOCKSLEY CASTLE, NOTTINGHAMSHIRE, ENGLAND INT. LOCKSLEY CASTLE - NIGHT FIRE CRACKLES in an open hearth. Hams and a half sheep hang, smoking. An old DOG SNORES at the fireside. A bone clunks on the floor, waking him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough of that din, Remus.    I can't think. Licking the bone gratefully, the dog looks in the direc- tion of the voice... Grey. Proud. Distinguished. LORD LOCKSLEY. Seated at a table, wine goblet in hand, he pores   over a wonderful illustrated Bible. Reading to himself    for solace and strength. Empty chairs surround the    vast table. A deep sense of loneliness. He glances     at a portrait over the fireplace... Robin. The dog jumps. Hackles rise. O.S. SHOUTS. Locksley unsheathes a dagger. Obscures it in the folds of the Bible. The door bursts open. A peasant, ragged, desperate, KENNETH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Lord!   Help me. He's bleeding from a face wound. Another man grabs him from behind. Locksley's craggy-faced retainer, DUNCAN. Older than his master, but still strong, he holds Kenneth back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must wait... I am sorry you were disturbed, Master.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (high anxiety) My Lord, please!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is alright, Duncan. (to Kenneth) You are Kenneth of Cowfall? The peasant falls to his knees. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've taken my Gwen.    My daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who has taken her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Men on horses. In masks. (touches his wound) We tried to stop them. My son is dead. EXT. LOCKSLEY CASTLE - NIGHT Steam pours from the nostrils of a black charger. Lord Locksley mounts, in armor. Duncan attempts to detain him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You cannot go alone, Master.      Let me ride for help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That may be too late. Kenneth, lead the way. He kicks his horse into motion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Master, stay!    There is an evil moon tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good will overcome, Duncan.      Trust in that. Duncan looks up.    Crosses himself.    Dark clouds race across the moon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They came this way, my Lord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Onward then.    What is this place? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nearby the Gregor Caves. Locksley reacts -- a hint of fear. They move on... Ahead, the hillside glows, rimmed in eerie light. Strange primitive CHANTS, wafted on the wind. Locksley ties his nervous horse to a tree. Parting undergrowth, Kenneth creeps forward. Cries out. He's face to face with the maggot-eaten skull of a goat. Beyond it, a gruesome host of half-skinned human skulls, all arranged on stakes. Some male, others with rotting female tresses, staring eyelessly into the night. Kenneth turns to run... A hand grabs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steady, man. They are to dissuade the faint of heart. Think of Gwen. From the crest of the rise, they peer down into the craggy valley. A cave opening, ablaze with flames leers at them like the mouth of hell. Before the cave, a circle of stones. A miniature Stonehenge. A medieval orgy. Men and women in masks and loose robes. Dancing. Drinking. Reveling. Pure carnality. Lord Locksley and Kenneth watch in horror. Faces ashen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Druids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I trusted we were rid of such evil a century ago. An unearthly SCREECH. A creature leaps into the circle of stones. Grotesque gargoyle head, horns, fur-covered arms and legs. A living Hieronymous Bosch DEMON. Its clawed hands slash across a reveler's back, drawing blood in vicious streaks. The creature tastes the blood. The reveler is ecstatic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (petrified) Is it the devil?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it is, I have some Christian steel that will test his hide. He draws his sword. A crucifix sculpted into the hilt. A girl is dragged from the cave. Kenneth buries his head. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gwen? Kenneth nods. The Demon shrieks, dervishing around GWEN, who  is carried onto the central plinth stone. A pagan   altar, the shape of an elephant's head with its trunk  raised. A masked figure stands at the head of the altar.   The high priest of the dark rite. The girl's body shudders as blood-red liquid is forced down her throat. The Demon's voice is husky and hideous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, my virgin flower. Hypnotized by the creature's voice and snake-like move- ments, Gwen stretches herself out. A single beam of sunlight slices through the mist, like a laser. The first light of the rising sun, it strikes directly on the altar, tracking down towards the girl's heart. The Demon's raised talons close in on the white flesh of her neck. Gwen's eyes are open wide, in a trance. The crowd of revelers encircle the plinth. Awed anticipation... A warrior's yell! Sword raised, Locksley THUNDERS in on his CHARGER. The terrified crowd parts. The Demon screams like a banshee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill him!   Kill him! The followers throw themselves at   Locksley. He beats them off. The high priest issues    orders to armed guards, who run to intercept. One aims a    spear. Locksley hacks the shaft in half. Cuts men down    left and right. Reaches the altar stone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gwen!   Up, girl, up! Gwen shakes off her trance. The Demon launches itself at Locksley. Talons rip flesh from his face. With all his strength, Locksley hurls the creature down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the name of God! His broadsword swings in a mighty arc. Slices across the gargoyle's skull. Clean through half the face... Impossibly, the demon rolls back to its feet. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The head is an elaborate mask -- beneath are the yellow skin, white hair, and burning red eyes of an albino crone. Screaming vitriol, the hag is unharmed. Momentarily stunned, Locksley regains his senses, hauls the girl onto his charger. The guards close in. Locksley spurs his horse. Rides for an opening. The masked high priest stands resolutely in his path. Brandishing a burning branch. The horse is freaked. Rears. Locksley and the girl are thrown. Unarmed, Locksley charges the man. Slams him into the cave wall. The mask falls. Locksley gasps in recognition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nottingham! The SHERIFF OF NOTTINGHAM. Powerful build, black beard, cruel intensity in every feature.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are an unwelcome surprise, Locksley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The King shall hear of this, Nottingham.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think not. Locksley is surrounded. One by one the men reveal their faces. Locksley backs up in shock, recognizing them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God help us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One day all England will worship with us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never. The crone spits venom in his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am Mortianna. You will die with my name on your lips. Locksley's agonized cry fills the valley. On the hill- side, Kenneth averts his eyes. Turns to run. Five masked figures block his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ENGLISH SHORE - DAY A twelfth century French sailboat at anchor.    A cross on its sail. A longboat rows to shore. Robin stands in the prow, in a pilgrim's hooded robe. He gazes at the approaching land. Unable to wait, he leaps into the surf and wades to the beach. He kneels, pressing his hands and face into the soil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Home.    Thank you, Lord. Aslan steps from the boat, sniffing the air. The French sailors keep their distance from him. Robin takes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My friend, you have escorted me home. I beg you to free yourself of your vow. Return with the boat. I know how heavy your heart must be, this far from your family and native land...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I love them so dearly, I cannot dishonor them. A sailor creeps up behind Aslan, club in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you'd say that. He nods to the sailor, who swings the club down. The Saracen sidesteps, grabs the man's arm and flips him into the surf. He turns a cold stare on Robin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No man controls my destiny. Especially not one who attacks downwind and stinks of garlic. Robin laughs.    The Saracen remains intense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If our positions were reversed, I would have done the same. Only I would have succeeded. He smiles broadly.    Robin claps him on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, Aslan. By nightfall we will celebrate your honor when we dine with my father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT./INT. PEASANT'S COTTAGE - DAY CRASH! An armored foot splinters the door of a farmer's hovel. Children scream and run. A soldier clubs at them, laughing. Outside. More soldiers. Some on horses, others on foot, with leashed hounds. Pillaging. Vandalizing. Searching. GUY GISBORNE: An impressive figure on horseback. Strikingly handsome -- except that one of his ears is missing. We recognize his face from the Druid ceremony. He coldly addresses a pregnant woman with a child in her arms, FANNY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You owe the sheriff three bushels of flax.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You starve us. First the drought, now you take what food we have left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For starving people, you look fat enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (emerging from the hut) He's not here, sir. None but the woman and children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Fanny) Where is your mate? The man they call Little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He died last winter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that so? We hear he     is very much alive. Hiding out     in the forest. He probably ran     away to escape your scolding    tongue. The soldiers join in his laughter. Incensed, Fanny pounds her fist on his legs. Gisborne kicks her down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman swine! A BOY of 12 springs from nowhere, thrusting a hay fork at Gisborne's throat. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Wulf! Don't! 'Twill only make it worse. Wulf backs off.   Nostrils flaring with repressed hate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seize him! While two soldiers grab the Boy, others examine his hiding place. A secret thatched door, built into the side of a haystack... a bow and quiver... and a deer carcass. Gisborne dismounts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Lord Nottingham's deer. Is this how you repay the Sheriff for his protection?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like a wolf protects sheep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I killed it.   We needed the meat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poachers hang. Either he dies or you die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mother lies to protect me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Wulf! Gisborne drags the boy to the carcass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have deprived us of a hunt, boy. He cups his hand in the deer's blood.    Smears it on Wulf's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hounds know the scent well. He tosses his bloody glove to the dogs. They tear at each other in their effort to rip at the glove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run, boy. Like a deer. Give us some pleasure before you die. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: To the accompaniment of the HOUNDS' savage HOWLS and the horrified screams of his family, Wulf runs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unleash them! EXT. COUNTRY ROAD - DUSK Nearing home, Robin is buoyant.     The Saracen, brooding, walks two paces behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why must you walk in back of me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In your land am I not the infidel? The unbeliever, the instrument of evil?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our races have fought for a hundred years to prove that point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I trust it is safer to appear as your slave than as your equal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For an 'infidel' you have uncommon clarity of thinking. Yet you refuse to tell me about your home and family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those are my burdens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You speak my language. You have the diplomacy and honor code of a nobleman. I ask again, why were you to be executed? The Saracen maintains a moody silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, I must continue with my guesswork. You are highborn? Probably... You fell from favor... Clearly... Why? You broke the law? You were a rival for power? ... A woman? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The Saracen reacts, almost imperceptibly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the Lord, that's it! Aslan is silent, but Robin knows he's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say there are Arab women of such beauty that they can possess a man's mind, that he would be willing to die for them. Is that not so? Ignoring him, the Saracen stops.      Examines the darkening sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is close to sunset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your people must marry women chosen for them by others, right? No reply.    Aslan unfolds a prayer rug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is she? The Mullah's daughter? ... Another man's wife?... That's it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Endless clouds. Is there no sun in your cursed country?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You dog! You painted old dog! What is her name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which way is East?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: East?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: East?!!! Robin folds his arms.    A standoff. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn you!... Jasmina.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, Jasmina!    Is she beautiful?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which way is East?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That way. Aslan throws his rug on the ground.    Kneels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would know blindfolded. I'm five miles from home... Was she worth it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worth dying for. Robin stands smiling over him as Aslan begins his prayers... BAYING of HUNTING DOGS... In the distance, the boy Wulf runs toward them, ducks behind a tree and clubs the leading dog with a branch. The other hounds close in... panting with exhaustion, Wulf swings into the branches. A hound savages his leg. The soldiers surround the tree. The boy clambers precariously onto the highest branch... Robin surrep- titiously steals a crossbow from one of the soldiers' horses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not playing by    the rules, boy. Deer don't climb     trees... Perhaps he thinks he's    a game bird. Shall we teach     him to fly? Cut it down! The soldiers hack at the trunk.    The tree quivers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold!... I am curious as to what manner of creature is so fearsome that it takes six men to attack it. Shrouded in his pilgrim's hooded cloak, he approaches them. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stand back, stranger. This is no affair of yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have we treed the devil himself? Let me see... Ah ha! A small boy. A truly dangerous animal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I advise you to move on, pilgrim. This is the Sheriff's land.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wrong. This is my land, and my tree. Therefore, whatever is in it also belongs to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I grow dangerously tired of your wit... Chop it down!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man who strikes that tree dies. He glances nervously at Aslan, who's still at his prayers. The men stop in mid-swing. More surprised than scared. Gisborne gestures to the largest of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chop down the hooded fool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (backing up) Perhaps we could discuss this. The soldier raises his sword. Robin lifts his cape... the crossbow. Shoots from the hip. The bolt thuds through the man's armor. He's dead before he lands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aslan!   It's time to redeem that vow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Set the dogs on him! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Aslan ignores him, lost in his   prayers. Robin lifts the other arm -- a second concealed   crossbow. WHUMPF! The bolt flips the dog handler into   the vicious pack. Dead or not, he soon will be. Robin    unsheathes his sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aslan, get off your damn knees! I have four of them cornered. The Saracen remains head down. Or did we see him steal a glance? Gisborne signals his men to attack. A wave of flashing steel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope there's enough of me to satisfy you all. Backed up to a tree, he grabs a branch and kicks out. Two men fly back. He lunges at a third. His sword strikes flesh. Robin sidesteps and hurls the fourth onto a sharp tree stump. Gisborne thrusts. Robin reacts too slowly.       Blood flows from his arm. His sword falls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aslan!! Gisborne is on him, sword pressed to his back.      Robin freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, hooded stranger, allow me to know your name before I run you through. A moment of silence... Like lightning, Robin spins, kicks out Gisborne's legs. Slams one foot on the man's sword arm, the other on his throat. Throws back his pilgrim's hood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robin of Locksley!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On your knees, Gisborne.   Pray. He obeys.    Robin raises his sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Locksley! No! Robin drives the point into Gisborne's rear.      The man leaps. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now get off my land. And tell your cousin the Sheriff what happens to his scum when they pick on my people. Gisborne takes off, colliding with Aslan as he folds his rug. Reacts in shock at the sight of the strange Arab. Keeps running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Aslan, furious) You worthless savage! You travel ten thousand miles to save my life, then leave me to be butchered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will fulfill my vow when I choose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which does not include prayer times, meal times, or any time I'm outnumbered six to one!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You whine like a mule.   You are still alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barely. Aslan examines Robin's wound.   Dismissive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A flesh wound. Why did you let their leader go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After six years of the stench of death, I have no stomach for needless blood on my hands. Wulf climbs cautiously from the tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have no fear, boy. The boy nervously eyes Robin and the Saracen, fingering a crucifix around his neck. Runs off into the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing) The conquering hero returns. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ha!   It was you he was scared of. Aslan's humor is infectious.     Robin's anger relents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, my strange friend. Beyond that hill lies the prettiest little castle in all Christendom. Warm hearths, hot food, real beds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With feather pillows?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With feather pillows. Warm and soft like Jasmina's embrace. EXT. LOCKSLEY CASTLE - NIGHT Ruins. The moon hovers ominously over the once-proud castle. Burned to the ground. Gutted and deserted. Towers demolished. Moat drained. Robin stares, struck dumb with horror. The dark courtyard.   Heartsick, Robin stumbles over debris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father!    Hello! His VOICE ECHOES around the fallen battlements. Aslan places a hand on his shoulder and points... Suspended high on a tower wall is a decaying human corpse. CLOSE - MEDALLION round the corpse's neck.   The Locksley crest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Noooooo! A paroxysm of rage and grief. He smashes furniture. Slams his fists relentlessly into the wall. Pained, Aslan looks on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should have been here. Spent, he leans against the wall. In the silence, they hear an eerie TAPPING. Robin draws his sword... A hunched, old man emerges, walking with the aid of a staff ... Duncan. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking him) Damn you, Duncan. Why didn't you cut him down?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Master Robin, is it you? A miracle. I thought God had abandoned us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You left my father to hang like a common thief, carrion for the crows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy... Look at him. Duncan steps into the moonlight.    His face crudely- scarred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What has happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say they captured him worshipping with the Druids. He signed a confession before the Bishop of Hereford.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did they have witnesses?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just one. Kenneth of Cowfall. The Bishop decreed all the Locksley lands forfeit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you believe the charges?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not even when they took my eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who did this to you, Duncan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guy of Gisborne. With the sheriff looking on. Robin holds the old retainer to his chest.    Stares into the night in silent rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NOTTINGHAM CASTLE - NIGHT Marked contrast.   A forbidding fortress.   Cliff-like battlements. INT. NOTTINGHAM CASTLE - NIGHT Face like thunder, Guy of Gisborne strides up curving, stone steps. A long corridor leads to a guarded oak door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir Guy. His Lordship is not to be disturbed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Away, fool. He shoves the Sentry aside. EXT. CASTLE BATTLEMENTS - NIGHT Torches illuminate Nottingham's face. Chilling cruelty in Manson-like eyes. Seated, his manicured hand dis- tractedly strokes a semi-naked girl. She sits at his feet like a frightened dog. When Gisborne enters, she covers up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who bade you cover up? He smashes his fist into his chair.   She timidly uncovers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cousin, I trust you justify your intrusion with news of profound value. His attention is riveted on a dark niche in the corner of the courtyard. UNEARTHLY SOUNDS emanate from the black- ness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I met a hooded man today. He bade me warn you not to harm his people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robin of Locksley. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ha! The prodigal son returns. He is a whelp. This girl could best him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This whelp bested five of my men in the blink of an eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your men were probably drunk.   Yet you survived, cousin? Heavy scorn. The sheriff pats Gisborne's hand like a child's. The voice from the darkness becomes a loud CHANT. A wrinkled, monkey-like figure dances INTO VIEW, wearing a necklace of human fingers. You might think she was a hundred years old, if not for her incredible agility. MORTIANNA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stunned) You brought her here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quiet! The crone's fingers dart into a bag. Emerge with a writhing, SQUEALING mass... a PIGLET. A knife flashes. Blood spurts into an ornate, sacred platter. The girl flinches in horror. Mortianna shakes the con- tents of a pouch across the bloody dish. Carved bone dice -- Runes. She rattles the platter. The rune symbols dance in trails of blood. Eyes vacant, mouth frothing, she hisses out her incoherent visions. Nottingham follows her every move. A connoisseur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Change the seat of power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: London?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Change it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Move the capitol to Nottingham? Excellent. How? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ally with royal blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put someone on the throne and rule through him? Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is not revealed. The idea takes shape in Nottingham's mind.      Mounting intensity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ally with royal blood. What else do you see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Armies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whose?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yours. Men and weaponry in great numgers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And victory?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Much blood will be spilled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whose? CLOSE SHOT A dice splashes blood. Lands -- a death's head symbol. Mortianna hammers the platter. The dice spins and lands again. Again the grinning skull. BACK TO SCENE The tray smashes to the ground.      The hag runs at Gisborne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who have you seen?! She shakes him.    Screams spittle in his face. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (freaked) No one. I have seen no one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lie!     A man... A painted man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have seen my death. She whimpers.   Spins, as if fearing invisible intruders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The painted man. He haunts my dreams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Locksley has a companion. A dark- skinned foreigner. He had the marked skin of Islam. Mortianna trembles like an epileptic.    Eyes wide with terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill them!     Kill them! She throws herself at Nottingham for protection.    He caresses her. Gisborne is thunderstruck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cousin. Prove to Locksley that your survival was his last mistake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (frantic) And the painted man! Kill him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill them both. He continues to stroke her.    Her trembling subsides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have done well, Mortianna. Exceedingly well. No one shall harm you, I swear it. Mortianna reaches out bloodied fingers towards the young girl, who shrinks away. Nottingham gently takes the girl's hand. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Draws it to his mouth, as if to kiss it... and bites down viciously, drawing blood. The girl screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, my child, Mortianna's kisses will seem soft, like an angel's. (to Mortianna) Take her. You have earned her. Mortianna grabs the terrified girl's wrist.   Drags her away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is madness bringing the hag here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fear not for my sanity, Guy. For in madness, there is great power. EXT. LOCKSLEY CASTLE - DAWN Red shards of sunlight slice through mist-shrouded trees. Robin hammers a crude cross over a hillside grave. Heads bowed, Duncan and Aslan stand at his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our last words in this world were spoken in anger. He called the Crusades a foolish quest, said it was vanity to force other men to our religion. He was right. (looks to Aslan, then back to the grave) Please forgive me, Father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He loved you till the end, young master. He never gave up hope of your return.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I failed him. I should have been here at his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must leave, head north to safety. Gisborne will surely seek revenge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what you're thinking. But one man can achieve nothing against so many. You would need an army.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, friend. He leads the old man away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He still stands vigil?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like a rock. Duncan offers half the bread to the Saracen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A curse on the Saracens! Were it not for their ungodly ways, he would never have left. This would never have happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It surprises me that one who curses others so readily has lived so long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do not recognize the style of your voice, friend. Are you Irish? A Cornishman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Er... no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What manner of name is Aslan then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fine Saracen name. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord, no! He chokes in shock.   Spitting bread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord, yes. But eat in peace. I take no offense. (glances at Robin) By the prophet! What is the man doing? Robin raises his dagger over his wrist.   Aslan runs to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! Too late. Robin slashes the dagger across his palm. Rain and blood mingle. Streaming onto the grave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear by my own blood. I will not rest until I have restored my father's name. (a whisper) ... Or until I am dead. EXT. FOREST PATH - DAY Ooze sucks at feet.   The three men stomp through mud and rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We make a fine army, do we not, Duncan? A blind man, an Arab, and a fool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fine, wet army. I have never witnessed a storm of such duration. When does summer come to this land?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is summer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then Allah truly is great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, pray? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No food, no shelter,   and weather that would curse the   end of the earth. We  will all   quickly be dead, and I shall be   rid of my vow. They approach a stone wall, surrounding a thatched mansion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You despair too soon, Aslan. We shall find food and shelter here among friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter's home. It is nearly seven years since we left here together. EXT. DUBOIS MANSION - DAY Robin pounds on the door.    A hatch opens.     An OLD WOMAN's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No beggars! The hatch slams shut.    Robin pounds again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open up! A pause.   The hatch slides back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell the mistress of the house that Robin of Locksley is at her door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her ladyship is not at home. She slams the hatch again.    Robin jams in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aagh! He shouts through the hatch, over his bruised fingers. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is the child Marian at home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe she is. Maybe she isn't. Remove that hand. Robin refuses. She waits imperiously behind the locked door. Robin reluctantly withdraws his hand. Instantly the hatch slams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hospitality here is as warm as the weather. They wait, shivering... The door opens a crack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave your weapons. The three start forward.       Her bony finger points at Robin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just you. INT. DUBOIS MANSION - DAY The hall. Deer heads.        Boar heads.   Portraits of ancestors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait here. He waits.    CREAKING FOOTSTEPS on the balcony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you? Dim lighting.    Robin cannot make out who it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am Robin of Locksley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lie.     Robin is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I may meet my maker soon from lack of sustenance. But for now I am real enough. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Step into the light.    Turn around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By heaven, am I to dance next? Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am the maid Marian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then show yourself, child.     For we knew each other well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the king away, these are lawless times. There are outlaws villainous enough to kidnap and ransom a relative of his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I am not one of them. Besides, I am sworn to protect you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs) Protect me? Robin of Locksley was nothing but a spoiled bully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allow that years of war and prison may change a man. Step forward, Marian, so I may see how you have changed. She moves into the light... Fat.     Rotten teeth.   Ugly as sin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Er... the years have been kind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Now remove yourself from this household. A figure steps behind Robin.    Sticks a sword in his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning away) As you can see, we are already well protected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, Marian!    ...ouch! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The sword is jabbed into his back. Robins faces the man -- clad in back, with a metal fighting mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are truly courageous against an unarmed man. The figure gestures towards the door. Robin sidesteps. Slams an elbow. The sword drops. Slides across the floor. Robin moves for it, but the man intercepts, drawing a dagger. Robin darts to the wall. Rips off an antlered deer head. Defends himself as the attacker slashes at the horns. OUTSIDE The SOUND of the fight indoors.   Aslan hurls himself at the door. It doesn't give. INSIDE Chunks of horn fly. Robin parries and thrusts.     The horns get shorter. Robin retreats. Left with just the nubs, Robin hurls the deer head at the mask. Gaining advantage, he charges. Grabs the dagger hand, smashes it into the wall. The knife drops. Robin wrenches off the mask. Long hair tumbles down... a beautiful YOUNG WOMAN. The front door CAVES IN. Aslan stumbles through... just in time to see the woman's knee fly up into Robin's crotch. Robin folds. The battle is over. The young woman stands over Robin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she was saying, we have no need of your protection. Robin croaks through clenched teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The fat girl, SARAH, who pretended to be Marian, serves. Flashes a lusty smile at Aslan, who glances at Robin -- "Help!" Marian arrives. In a gown. Stunning. An impish grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I trust Lord Locksley has recovered from his indisposition. Aslan laughs.   Robin glares. EXT. DUBOIS MANSION - DAY Rock-strewn hills. Grazing sheep. Sun peeking through clouds. Robin and Marian walk. Anger and anguish in her voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would he wish me to be protected by the boy who burned my hair when I was a child?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were together five terrible years in a Saracen prison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do I know you didn't abandon him there to save your own skin. Robin hands her Peter's ring.   She is shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marian, I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will forward your condolences to my mother. She turns her back.   He searches for a way to reach her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On my return, I found my father dead. The Sheriff denounced him as a Druid and took our lands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The people fear the Druids so much they'd believe anything. Nottingham would have me burned at the stake as a witch if he thought he could possess my property. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you not join your mother in London? You would be safer there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will not retreat.     Besides, I have no interest in    life at court. Gossip-mongering and    currying favor. Here I am my     own person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The you must allow me to be your guardian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do not need a guardian. She turns to face him.   Streaming tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My brother is dead. You cannot take his place. Robin grabs and holds her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marian, I don't want to replace him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want? Their eyes meet... a sudden intimacy between them. Robin moves closer. Marian begins to respond, then pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is wrong. She runs back to the house. Robin stares after her. Aslan appears in the doorway with Duncan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robin! The old man hears horses. Approaching fast. He runs to a bluff... a column of soldiers snakes up the hillside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty or more. In battle armor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soldiers coming here?     Is this your protection? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I killed some of the Sheriff's men. I fear I have placed you in danger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can take care of myself. There are horses in the stable. Go! Aslan runs into the stables.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not leaving. Marian ices him with a glare. Aslan reappears, with two bareback horses. Soldiers appear on the crest, led by Gisborne... With a mischievous grin, Marian runs to the soldiers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop them!   They're stealing my horses!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn the girl! Aslan, can you ride? In answer, Aslan grins. Leaps onto a horse. With a single swift move he hoists Duncan up behind him and digs in his heels. The mare leaps forward, and over the estate wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can ride. He heads his horse at the wall. It stumbles. Barely clears it. Stones fly. Robin struggles to hold on. Marian stands directly in Gisborne's path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have been sheltering outlaws, Lady Marian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're thieves, you imbecile. Bring back my horses, or the Sheriff will know of your cowardice. Gisborne knows she is lying. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're lucky he didn't steal your virtue too. (to his men) A crown to the man who brings me Locksley's head. He leads the pursuit.   A SOLDIER hangs back.   Grabs Marian's hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A kiss for me, Saxon bitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kiss this! She unsheathes the dagger from under her skirt.    Jabs the blade into his wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try me again, if you want to leave a hand behind. Shocked and pained, the man gallops away. Marian looks down at her dagger hand. It shakes violently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn you, animal! Aslan shouts from the far bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Treat it like a woman. Robin continues to hit his horse and hurl abuse. Closing in, the soldiers unfurl their crossbows. A flight of BOLTS WHISTLES ominously close to Robin. He must jump or die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you never had a woman? Gently, man. Soothe it! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course I've had a woman! Come on, pretty one. He pats the horse soothingly.    The animal edges forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Softly.   With your knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know!   I know! The soldiers reload.   Robin urges the horse at the steep drop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, easy. Another wave of crossbow bolts. Robin launches the frightened animal into space. Hooves flail... touch down. Scramble up the other bank. Robin enthusiastically pats the horse's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you! The first two pursuers misjudge their leaps.     Their mounts land sprawling in the riverbed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yelling) Robin of the Hood! Son of the devil worshipper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is your pleasure, Gisborne?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was I who strung your father's corpse to the castle gate. My pleasure will be in doing the same to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You survived one meeting.    Our next will be your last.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father died a coward, cursing your name and squealing like a stuck pig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a lie! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Incensed, he is losing his judgement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouts) Come, Robin! He is trying to anger you into a trap. A shaft pierces the flank of Robin's horse. It rears in fright. Robin clings on. Six soldiers, the men Gisborne split off, are climbing the embankment towards him. Robin regains control. Rides right at them. Scatters them, and takes off again. Gisborne yells at his men to follow. Robin and Aslan ride flat out. Open land turns to scrub. Seeing no followers, Robin pulls up and dismounts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have lost them. I'll lame this mare if I ask her to go any farther. He gently extracts the shaft from his horse. Aslan opens his pouch. Pulls out two shiny clear pebbles and a square leather hide. Rolls the pebbles into the tube and holds it to his eye. A primitive telescope. Robin watches, curious. SCOPE POV Through the scope we see the movement on the hill behind them. BACK TO SCENE ASLAN Here they come. Look. Robin puts the device to his eye... SCOPE POV The soldiers are close! BACK TO SCENE He reacts in shock. Prepares to defend himself.    Then realizes they are still in the distance. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this Arab magic?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.    Arab science. He replaces the tube in his pouch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did your uneducated kind ever take Jerusalem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God knows! Aslan laughs.   Robin points towards an endless expanse of trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can lose them in the forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherwood is haunted, Master.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Either we take our chances with the ghosts, or become ghosts ourselves. He remounts. They race into the trees. Gisborne's men thunder up,... slowing as they enter the forest. Peering around them in trepidation, they slowly rein in. Robin looks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're not following. Gisborne curses his men, urging them on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, damn you! There are only three of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not the men we fear, sir. Eerie HOWLING and RATTLING of bones.    Aslan draws his sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Banshees. They say they fly in your mouth and suck you dry of blood before you can scream. He wraps his scarf over his mouth. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be quiet!    Listen. WIND GUSTS the trees in angry waves. Emits deathly SHRIEKS. The HORSES WHINNEY. Unnerved, Aslan smites around him with his scimitar. Wheels at the sounds, striking only air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allah protect us from the evil spirits. Duncan clings to his back.   Robin points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind you! Aslan slashes out, futilely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, there!    And there! Aslan flails.   Robin cracks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cease your mad laughing.     I can feel them. Robin reaches into the branches. Pulls out a string of hollowed wooden tubes -- WINDCHIMES. Dozens of such strings on all the trees. He blows over the hollow end. A low chilling MOAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here are your ghosts, Duncan. A child's toy put to good use. You scare easily, my painted Saladin. His laughter is broken by a piercing YELL. A red- jacketed figure swings down out of a tree on a rope. Catapults him to the ground. The bushes are instantly alive. Shaggy, wild-eyed men, armed with cudgels, scythes and hayforks. Twelfth- century Hell's Angels. The red-jacketed young turk, WILL SCARLET, leaps around Robin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (singing) Ring around the rosie!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aslan! Aslan makes no move to intervene. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The woodsmen eye the bizarre stranger, keeping their distance from him. Will kicks at Robin, who tries to grab him. Will skips out of range. Robin falls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Atishoo, Atishoo. We all fall down. Beg for mercy, rich man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I beg of no man. Which of you scum has guts enough to face me man to man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, bollocks, mate. Robin looks up... I mean up! A towering figure. Seven feet of grinning, muscled brute. The giant extends a vice that passes for a hand. Hauls Robin to his feet. His eyes twinkle with merriment. His whole body shakes when he laughs, which is often.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are ya, m'old cock?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Er... Robin... He pauses, checking the faces of the angry peasants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Hood.   Robin Hood.   Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John Little.   Bestman o' the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bestman?   You lead this rabble?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We waste time. Tax him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tax?   For what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For passage through Sherwood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will pay no tax. Besides, I have nothing but my cloak and my sword. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man who travels with two servants and claims he's without money, is either a fool or a liar. Grabbing Robin, Little shakes him like a doll. Something CLINKS. Robin's father's medallion. Laughing heartily, Little rips it from Robin's neck and tosses it to Scarlet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this one is a liar. (he bites the metal) Ahah! Gold! The men cheer.   John snatches the medallion back from Will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is sacred to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sacred to us too, mush. This here'll feed us for a bloomin' month. Robin draws his sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will have to fight me for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd love to, mate. He grins hugely.   A boy pushes his way through the throng.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, father!    I know him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This man is your father? Tell him how I saved your hide from the Sheriff's soldiers. That deserves some gratitude, I believe. He reaches for the medallion.    John pulls it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw ya don't, laddie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be Robin of Locksley. The blackguard who abandoned us to Nottingham's plundering. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be careful, Father. He fights like a demon. He walloped six o' Sheriff's men?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that so? Another grin. Licking his lips in anticipation, he lunges for Robin's wrist. Wrenches the sword free. Bends it into a pretzel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aslan! Aslan shrugs. Robin swings a fist into the giant's gut. John doesn't flinch. Hoists Robin off the ground with one arm. Cannonballs the other fist into Robin's stomach. Robin folds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh dear! The little rich boy is lost for words. Thanks for the taxes, Locksley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And for the laughs. The woodsmen find this hysterical. They disappear into the tree. Will administers one final kick before leaving. Robin staggers to his feet. Glares furiously at Aslan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of an Arab whore! Once again your assistance was invaluable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You seemed more in danger of losing your pride than your life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I recognized some of the voices. Many were from your father's farms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your avenging army, my friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That rabble?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All they need is a leader. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have a leader.   A very large one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Defeat him and they will follow you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allah has taken your brains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear the voice of a spoiled child, Master Robin. I suggest you cease your brave talk of revenge and flee to the north.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You, too? You expect me to fight that behemoth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father would expect you to act like a man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my bridge. No one crosses without paying tax.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just bugger off, mate, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you wish to cross, it will cost you a gold medallion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't I hurt you a bloody nuff for one day?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he's in a hurry to end his mortal misery, help him. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have the courage to face me again, John Little? Or should I call you 'Little John'? John grabs a hefty, gnarled staff.   Strides to the bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, m'old cock. You wanna nuther good wallopin'? His confidence melting, Robin glances back at Duncan and Aslan, who grins like a fan at a boxing match. John storms at Robin. Staffs thrash. Driven back, Robin connects a blow on John's foot. The giant is off-balance. Robin follows up. Lands a couple to the ribs. John responds with heavy swings, which Robin blocks deftly. Back and forth, blow for blow, all blocked. John chuckles with every swing. Enjoying the time of his life. Their staffs lock. It's strength against strength. Robin is no match. With one mighty thrust, John hurtles him into the stream. The woodsmen cheer loudly. Aslan watches impassively. Robin scrambles back onto the bridge.   John waits, grinning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lil' wet behind the ears, mate?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't fool with him. Get him! John charges. Robin fends him off, gets in some shots of his own. John swings in a giant arc. Robin ducks. John loses balance and falls to his knees. Robin allows him time to right himself. John comes at him again, pummeling. Wood splinters from the impact. Brute force versus agility. Agility is beginning to prevail, when Robin's staff splits in two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swimmin' time again, ol' chum. The coup de grace. Lands heavily. Robin teeters. Falls. Disappears under the foaming water... does not re-emerge. John waits. The spectators rush to the bank. No sign. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bloomin' shame. 'E were a brave 'un. Suddenly Robin arcs up out of the water. His hands clamp onto John's ankles. Robin heaves with all his might. John topples headfirst into the water. Surfaces in panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help!   Cain't bloody swim. He submerges again.   Robin pulls his head above water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you yield? The terrified giant sputters. Goes under again, flailing with arms and legs. Robin holds his head just above the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you yield?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.   Now put your feet down. John struggles, then his feet hit bottom... The water only reaches his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be buggered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pay me the tax. A tense pause while all wait for Little's reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robin Hood, ya got balls o' solid rock. He hands Robin back the medallion. Chuckling loudly, he swoops Robin up in his arms and carries him to the bank. EXT. SHERWOOD FOREST - NIGHT A BONFIRE CRACKLES. The woodsmen drink, eat, argue, and fight. A rabble. John passes Robin a jug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mead.   Made it m'self. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (drinks) A fine brew, Little John. He spits black objects from his mouth.      Dead bees.   John grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Real honey. He takes the jug back. Sneezes royally, spewing all over the brew. Oblivious, he hands the contaminated jug to Aslan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With regrets, I decline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An Englishman's mead not bleedin' good enough for ya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the contrary. I thank you, but my faith prevents me from partaking in such enjoyments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your bloody loss, mate. He swigs.    Passes the jug on to Duncan, who drinks heartily.    Wulf cautiously approaches Robin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it, boy? Speak up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna thankee, Lord Locksley. I owes ya m'life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You owe me nothing, Wulf. I am glad I chanced by in time to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, lad, drink! 'Twill put hair on your bloomin' chest. Wulf tries the brew. The impact is instant.       He turns green and runs. His father cracks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me about your men, John. John points to a short fellow with the build of a tree trunk. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This stumpy one 'ere's David o' Doncaster. We calls 'im Bull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you come by the name, Bull?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cuz o' my size, Sire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you are short?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nay.   'Cuz I be so long. Proudly, he starts to pull down his pants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Bull.    Save it for the ladies. Drunken laughter.    Robin turns to the next man at the fireside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your name, friend? The man's bald pate blushes scarlet as he tries to respond, but he stutters too badly to get out a comprehensible word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That be Hal Brownwell, but the lads call i'm Hal Hiccup. The others make hiccup and belching sounds, and crack up at Hal's embarrassment. Hal strikes out angrily at his tormentors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold! Hal, you have the face and hands of a farmer. I wager you are a strong and honest man, and I'd be glad to have you at my side in a fight. The next man who makes light of you will have to answer to me. There is murmuring around the group, but no one elects to try it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How is it there are so many of you in hiding? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're outlaws. Got prices on our 'eads, every man jack. Blasted Sheriff says we owes 'im taxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you fare?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We get by, I reckon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: While the Sheriff steals your land and your families starve?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What in bloody blazes'd ya have us do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your ghosts will only keep his men at bay so long, my friend. Soon the Sheriff will hunt you down and hang you. You must fight back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We show as much as a toe outside the forest, they'll slaughter us like bleedin' sheep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We must organize. Win by guile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'We'? Ya lookin' to join us, matie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   To lead you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ha! I would never be led by the son of a Druid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are many here who knew my father to be a kind and generous man. I doubt that in their hearts they believe him capable of such a horror. Murmurs of agreement from around the fire.    Robin turns to Will. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is your name, friend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Count me not a friend, Locksley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stuff a flippin' cork in it, Will. The man's our guest. Will gets up.   Angrily pushes his way out of the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That there's Will Scarlet. Pay 'im no 'eed. 'E's full o' piss and wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is right to distrust me. I am a rich man's son. I have done no honest labor. But today I am as poor as any of you. Nottingham has stolen all that I own. And when I killed Gisborne's men, I, too, became an outlaw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya're full o'bloody wind an' all, mate. This 'ere load o' rubbish agin the Sheriff's bloomin' army? Ya must be bloody jokin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can win.   And I believe we will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya're a daft bugger, Robin Hood, but ya're a brave 'un, I'll give ya that. Drink up, laddie, cuz tomorrow ya mayn't be so lucky! Tomorrow I shall best ya an' crack that blasted noble head in two. Laughing loudly, he throws back his head for a long draught of mead. EXT. WOODSMEN'S CAMP - SUNRISE A steady trickle of RAIN drips from leaves onto the nose of the sleeping Saracen. He wakes, cursing. All around him the woodsmen lie on the forest floor, covered with rags and hides coughing and sneezing. A sorry mess. Robin sits, brooding. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gloomily) I have led you wrong. This is no army. These men live like dogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: English dogs.    They can learn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Learn what?   To build kennels? He sullenly stalks away. Robin shakes his head. Aslan is right. He rouses Duncan, who is asleep at his side. The old man groans awake, holding his head. Seriously hung-over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too much mead, old friend.    What day is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sunday, I believe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Do they still give alms to the poor at the mass?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They do. These days the need for mercy is greater than ever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I must ask you a favor. EXT. ROAD TO NOTTINGHAM - DAY Duncan walks alone, with the aid of his staff. Body stooped, clothes ragged, a pathetic figure. Ahead is the main gate to the walled city of Nottingham. Fresh horse manure. A man's hand reaches into it and spreads it over his clothes. And his face -- Robin, dressed as Duncan. EXT. CITY GATE - DAY Robin taps his way through the crowd. Past the piercing stare of the armored GUARD at the gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you! Robin keeps going.   A hand clasps his shoulder.    Spins him 'round. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I know you? Robin gazes into space, trying to look blind.   The Guard sniffs his soiled hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, you stink!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pardon my blindness, sir.    I'm always falling down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeech!   Get away from me. He launches a kick in Robin's rear. Robin hobbles away, hiding a smile. The Guard tries to wipe off his hand on the wall. INT. NOTTINGHAM CATHEDRAL - DAY Jesus hangs from the cross. A magnificent stained glass window. In the ornate pulpit, the BISHOP OF HEREFORD, bedecked in ermine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We beseech thy blessing, Lord, on all your people, but most especially on our noble Lord Nottingham. Grant him the wisdom to guide and protect our glorious city. Nottingham and Gisborne sit piously among the congrega- tion of nobles and wealthy merchants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grant him also the strength to bring to justice the lawless men who threaten its safety. Help him to stamp out the curse of the dread Druids who would seize from us our children, even as wolves steal the lambs from their mothers. The rear of the church. Standing crushed together, the poor and afflicted. Old and young. Starving children. Among them, Robin. The sermon ends. As the nobles file out, the poor are galvanized. Begging hands reach out. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   Alms!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Trilogy Entertainment Group in association with:                    July 10, 1990 WARNER BROS. INC.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Warner Boulevard
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : SUNSET The glowing orb ripples like a blood-red eye. BLACK, ROBED FIGURE A face of the ages. Dark, wrinkled skin. Wizened, almond eyes. He howls at the sun. His voice ECHOES across the sky. The Moslem call to prayer. Hundreds of feet below his tower, a mud-walled city of minarets and mosques. A human ants' nest. Scurrying to their devotions. EXT. TWELFTH-CENTURY ARAB CITY - ESTABLISHING SHOT INT. DUNGEONS - SUNSET Pervasive blackness. Moans of men in pain. Dripping water. Rats. Filth. The nadir of human degradation. Bedraggled white men, POWs from the Crusades, caged together with Arab cutthroats. Jailers wrench two crusaders from their cell. ROBIN OF LOCKSLEY and PETER DUBOIS. Their appearance reeks of long imprisonment, but remnants of their noble heritage still glimmer in their faces. Peter is so frail he can barely walk. INT. TORTURE CHAMBER - SUNSET A furnace. Torture instruments glow red hot. Chained victims. A massive INTERROGATOR scrutinizes the two white men. Indicates a rat-faced lowlife, who points at Peter, jabbering in Arabic.
dialogue.name: dialogue
