dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. WOODED TRAIL Kenneth checks the ground.    Locksley waits.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : GRAVE SIDE - LATER Pouring rain. Robin stands drenched at the grave side. Aslan watches from the shelter of trees. Duncan heats a stale chunk of bread over the ashes of a small fire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. KITCHEN Liquid tumbles into a goblet.   The three men at a table in the kitchen. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. STREAM Water erupts under hooves. Aslan fords a stream. Duncan hangs on for dear life. Robin strives to keep up. Half a mile behind Gisborne splits up his men. Trying for a short cut, Robin finds himself at the steepest part of the river gorge. His horse balks at the drop. Robin flails at his mount with hands and feet. It backs away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. FOREST CLEARING - DAY A large tree trunk spans a swift-flowing river. The ragged band of woodsmen approach the makeshift bridge. Stop in their tracks. Robin stands on the bridge, brandishing a long wooden staff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .   Have mercy, milady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   Pity, fine sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   For my baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   Etc. The rich drop a few mites, sparking a mad scramble. Church officials roughly keep order. Marian passes some coins to the mother of a small child. A hand grabs her wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alms for a blind man. For one who cannot see your beauty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (recognizing him) This is dangerous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you care for my safety?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, for mine. I do not wish to be seen with an outlaw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Under the Sheriff's law, that's a badge of pride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's put a price on your head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hundred gold pieces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that all? I have not annoyed him enough. Soon he will offer ten thousand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For ten thousand I would turn you in myself. (glances back at the Sheriff) Nottingham is mounting an army.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has rounded up every blacksmith in the county. He has them holed up in the castle making swords and armor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is he planning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, but there's no limit to the man's ambitions. (as Sheriff heads towards them) Go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you need me, I will be with the woodsmen. Send for me as 'Robin Hood.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robin!   Do something for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a bath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Care to join me? With a grin, he slips into the crowd as Nottingham arrives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shine like the sun, my lady. He raises her hand, as he did the girl's in the castle. Kisses it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have been meeting with young Robin of Locksley. (as she tries to hide her shock) My cousin tells me the knave deprived you of some horses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (recovering) Yes. A most disagreeable experience. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I deeply regret it, and I promise you he will be brought to justice. For subjecting you to such treatment, I will hang him from the walls with his own entrails. That gleam of insanity.   Robin watches from a distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would like to see that, my lord. The Sheriff places his hand possessively on her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My dear, a woman of your refinement is not safe living alone. If you would consent to bring your household within the city walls, I could give your needs my most personal attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thank you, Lord Nottingham, from the heart, but for now I prefer to stay in my family's ancestral home. My cousin, King Richard, will be deeply moved to hear of your concern for my welfare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alas, the King has many enemies both abroad and at home. I fear for his safe return.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fear not, my dear Sheriff. He will return. When he does, he will wish to reward his faithful subjects. The Sheriff smiles sourly and takes his leave. Marian deflates with relief. The Sheriff walks alone towards a side door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Robin) Alms, my lord. Nottingham makes to shove the man aside. With a swift move, the beggar grabs the Sheriff in a headlock. Slides Nottingham's own dagger to his throat and drags him out of sight. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hundred crowns, Sheriff?   You insult me. Nottingham starts to struggle.   Robin draws blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember young Robin of Locksley, Sheriff? Meet Robin Hood. Your nemesis. Your avenging angel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you kill me, you will hang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I kill you, I will hang happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to give you a chance. A chance you do not deserve. A chance to right your wrongs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From this day forward you will cease to tax my people. You will renounce the charges against my father, and you will return his lands to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why should I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because for every harm you do, I swear by God I shall visit on you threefold in return.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Empty words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am here with a blade at your throat. As long as I live, you will always know that I could be here again. A YELL from across the church. Gisborne has spotted them. Robin digs the knife a little deeper. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your answer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never, fool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then it will begin.. Gisborne yells orders.   Robin hurls Nottingham against the wall. EXT. NOTTINGHAM CATHEDRAL - DAY Robin runs to the courtyard and leaps on the Sheriff's horse, which is held by a stunned groom. He rides through the busy marketplace. A crossbowman tracks him. A sure shot. Marian spots the danger. She fakes being tripped and stumbles into the bowman. His bolt flies harmlessly into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (innocently) Please excuse my clumsiness. Robin charges for the city gate. As he passes, he kicks the guard who hasseled him into the wall. EXT. WOODSMEN'S CAMP - DAY Men gather around as Robin dismounts, admiring the horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A personal loan from the Sheriff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (furious) You should not have left without me, Englishman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How so? You have not raised a finger to protect me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before I had a choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was my choice to do this alone. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A foolish risk. If you had been killed, I would be cursed for eternity for failing to fulfil my pledge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aslan, if I didn't know better, I would swear you were worried about me. EXT. NOTTINGHAM CATHEDRAL The Sheriff maniacally spits out orders to Gisborne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Starve them out. Slaughter their livestock. I want to see Locksley's own people fighting each other to bring him to us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear he will not live to see the next full moon. EXT. HAMLET - DAY A SQUEALING HOG is loaded onto a wagon. SOLDIERS round up the livestock. An old FARMER protests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go' bless ya, sir. Leave us the sow. She's with young 'uns. The next litter'll feed us through the winter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've heard of Robin Hood?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. The Soldier brutally kicks the old man to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then pray he is brought to us before winter. EXT. WOODSMEN'S CAMP - DAY A trail of refugees. Women and children carry their belongings into camp. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Wulf runs to greet his mother and siblings.    A contingent of woodsmen confronts Robin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You brought this misery on us, Locksley. We can barely feed ourselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheriff hasn't left us a bloody pot to piss in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we shall take from him and his rich friends. This provokes a barrage of protests.   The men are angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brave talk, Locksley. I say we take the rich boy in. Murmurs of general agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, do you think the Sheriff will give everything back after I am gone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He will give us the reward, and our pardons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, Will. You can take me in on one condition. You must fight me. You may use the Sheriff's horse and arm yourself as you please. I will fight on foot. Unarmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unarmed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you lose, you will accept me as your leader. If you win, you may take me in. Dead or alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead, Locksley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. WOODSMEN'S CAMP - DAY (LATER) Hands tighten a girth. Will confidently jokes with his cronies. Woodsmen form a primitive circle of spectators. Little John and his wife, Fanny, keep to themselves, while Wulf openly talks with Robin, Aslan and Duncan. Robin is stripped to the waist, his muscled skin ravaged with scars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This man has true purpose.    He means to kill you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you have given him the means.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will is ruthless, Robin.    Guard your back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am grateful for your concern, friends, but I have to prove to them it is possible to overcome unequal odds. (shouts) I am ready, Will. Will bends, as if checking the horse's legs. Secretly grabs a handful of sand. Swings into the saddle and digs in his heels. Closing in, Will flings the sand in Robin's eyes. Robin clutches his hands to his face, blinded. Will spins back to the attack. His sword slashes. Reacting to the sound, Robin rolls aside. The men cheer like a big fight crowd. Robin's POV is blurred. Ducking the blade, he grabs Will's arm. A blow glances off his shoulder. Robin falls to his knees, still blinded. Will rides right at him, to trample him. Robin scrambles away. Will wheels his horse. A flashing hoof grazes Robin's chest. Robin leaps to his feet and yells at the top of his lungs. Panicked, the HORSE rears, WHINNYING wildly. Will struggles to stay in the saddle. Loses his sword. Robin seizes the moment and runs to a water trough. Douses his face. Yells at Will. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, you little piss pot. Do your worst! Will grabs a spear from a bystander. Robin stands his ground. Will lunges, Robin sidesteps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The horse is smarter than you are, Will. Some of the men laugh. Will is incensed. Robin ducks and weaves, easily evading Will's repeated charges. Robin ducks right under the horse's belly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, Will!   You aim like a girl, Will! Will stabs wildly, more and more frustrated. Laughter spreads, as Robin plays hide and seek around the horse's legs. Grabbing the end of the spear, he clowns a tug of war. Enraged, Will strains and tries to kick Robin away. Suddenly, Robin lets go. Unbalanced, Will flies back- wards off his mount. Robin snatches the spear and raises it over his fallen adversary. The crowd falls silent. Robin strikes. The point quivers in the ground below Will's crotch. Will wriggles in terror. Impaled, his pants rip open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank the Lord you are not endowed like Bull. The crowd is convulsed with laughter. Robin catches his breath. Does not see Will, who grabs a heavy staff and runs at him. A strong hand grasps Will's arm as he is about to strike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bollocks, Will. Jus' bugger off, eh? Overpowered, Will relents.   With a defiant glance, he skulks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya got us by the short and curlies, Robin Hood. Now let's hear what ya got to bleedin' say. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Robin scans the faces.     He has their attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nottingham has taken from us everything we own. Now we are going to start taking from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Ow in bloody blazes are we gonna do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are going to tax him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here they come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two wagons.   Twenty escort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty?   They usually have five. He grabs the telescope. SCOPE POV A phalanx of   mounted soldiers, a cart loaded with barrels, and   a tax wagon. The wagon is an armored box on wheels, with   crossbow slits in the side. Guy of Gisborne commands the   escort. BACK TO SCENE ROBIN This is no ordinary convoy. Bull calls up from below, where a ragged group of woods- men lies nervously in ambush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'ow many? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Er, about ten. (then, to Aslan) Why scare them? They can't count anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And they call me the barbarian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go. Together they run down the hill, keeping low. Gisborne eyes the forest. The beer cart is steered by a fat red-faced FRIAR, raucously singing hymns and quaffing from a jug, which he repeatedly dips into one of the barrels. ARROWS WHISTLE in. The Friar yells and drops his jug. A soldier is hit. At the forest edge, four woodsmen reload their longbows. Dressed in green, their faces camouflaged. The mounted soldiers charge them. The  woodsmen run into the trees. As the horsemen close in,  the runners leap into a trench. Lift up matted screens  of brush and grass. It's as if they disappeared.   The soldiers slash wildly at the thick screens. More arrows fly. More soldiers fall. The others spin in confusion, trying to discern the enemy. More woods- men break from cover. Run down a narrow path. Gisborne urges his men to pursue. They ride in single file, beating their way through the tangled branches. The runners dive into the trees, as other men haul on ropes, raising a giant screen in the soldiers' path. The horses swerve, on the edge of a twenty-foot drop to the river gorge. Momentum  carries many of them over the cliff. BACK ON ROADWAY Robin and Aslan swing down from the trees onto the tax wagon. Kick down the two drivers and take the reins, steering the wagon off the road. The archers inside are unable to fire at them. Little John leaps onto the beer cart, sending the Friar hurtling back among the barrels. The Friar slams his head and drops unconscious. John whips the horse, driving the cart after Robin. Another camouflage screen is lifted into place, covering their route. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Gisborne races back to the road... the wagons are gone. He rides frantically back and forth. Searching and cursing. EXT. FOREST CLEARING - DAY Robin climbs onto the tax wagon's roof.     Angry shouts from inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surrender your weapons. I give you my word you shall go free. In answer, a swordblade jabs up through the roof, near his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, I feared as much. He signals to Aslan, who steers the tax wagon into the river. Water floods in through the slits. Inside, panic. Drowning rats. The bowmen scramble out. What they see stops them dead. Both banks are men in green, longbows aimed directly at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (awestruck) I'll be buggered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This treasure had a purpose.     We must find out what. He turns at the sound of a brawl from the Friar's cart. The Friar is at the bottom of a struggling heap of bodies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get off him.   He's a man of the cloth. Robin drags the men off. The Friar clambers to his feet. Around him are strewn battered and winded woodsmen. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Lord's blessing on you, kind sir. These sinners were attempting to steal these libations destined for the monks of St. Catherine's. He indicates his cargo of barrels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It appears to me, Reverend Friar, that many of the libations have found their way into your own esteemed person. Ignoring him, the Friar mounts the cart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A thousand pardons, sir, but duty beckons. I must hasten on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grabbing the bridle) A moment, my reverend friend. You travel with poor company when you travel with Nottingham's soldiers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye, tax him. This sparks a chorus of comments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My men are thirsty and have much to celebrate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord bless me, sir, are these your men? I had mistook them for common thieves. Kindly step aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surely the Lord has the charity to spare a few barrels to good Christian men. The Friar relents, loosening his grip on the reins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, sir, if you wish them to share in the good Lord's brew... Casually reaching under the seat, he pulls out a club. Smites Robin with it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... you must best me for it. Robin staggers. The Friar whips up the horse. Dazed, Robin grabs for the fat man's leg. Gets a holy sandal full in the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Giddyup, nag! The Friar's horse, as obese as his driver, slowly raises his head from the grass and ambles forward. Robin runs after them and dives at the Friar, toppling him from the cart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You leave when I say. Scrambling to his feet, the Friar glances skyward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Protect me, Lord. He sweeps his foot, knocking Robin's legs out from under him. Hurls his full body weight on top of him. Whooomf!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yield! He bounces on Robin's stomach. Robin can barely breathe. The woodsmen are enjoying the spectacle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Confess that Friar Tuck is a better, holier, and braver man than thou art, knave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never!   Whoomf!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yield, I say!    Yield to Friar Tuck. Desperate, Robin bites the Friar's leg. Tuck howls. Robin extricates himself, grabs for a weapon. Smashes the Friar's head with his drinking jug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yield yourself! He dives onto the Friar and hammers his head into the ground. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yield to Robin Hood. Tuck holds up a hand in surrender.    Robin eases off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (feeling his head) Thank you, Lord, for teaching me humility.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Friar Tuck. We have need of an honest man of God, to minister to these men and their families. What do you say? The Friar struggles to his feet. He reviews the motley faces of his potential flock. His eyes light on the grinning Saracen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd rather roast in hell. He punches Robin in the gut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Giddyup, Friar. He flicks the reins, steering the cart into camp. Women and children rush to greet their men. Jeer the roped soldier-prisoners. The Friar checks out his flock. A woman curtsies, another crosses herself, children touch his robe in wonder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you say now, Tuck?    Here are the meek of the earth. Tuck surveys the hopeful, hungry faces. The little hamlet of half-built huts. He folds his hands in a moment of prayer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Lord moves in mysterious ways. I accept. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will not regret it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye, but you may.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buy yourself a new son, Stephen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thankee, Robin. Little John and Bull approach. John indicates the two prisoners roped to a nearby tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cain't get a bleedin' squeak outa 'em, Rob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'd be spittin' it out good if they'd knowed anythin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reckon the Cap'n knows summat, Rob, but stubborn ol' cocker 'e is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps it is time for some heathen persuasion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spare your breath. I know nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reasonable) I believe you. But this Arab here, he's got it into his barbarian brain that you know a whole lot more than nothing. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And when he gets like this, he's very hard to reason with. With a hair-raising war cry, Aslan   leaps INTO VIEW. Stripped to the waist, brandishing   his scimitar. The Captain tries to back away. Robin    tries to restrain Aslan, is hurled aside. Snarling,    drooling at the mouth, Aslan explores the Captain's body   with his hands. A butcher checking meat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I strongly advise you to talk. He hasn't eaten in weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (rising terror) What does he want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For Godsakes, get him off me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very deliberately) No, Aslan... not this one, Aslan. ... How about this other one?... Fatter, yes... more meat. The other soldier, who definitely  has more flesh on the bone, is struck dumb with horror,  as Aslan turns his attention to him. With one swing   of his sword, Aslan slices through the man's ropes.   Drags him to his feet. Little John runs over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (urgent) No, Robin, no! They be God-fearin' men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I cannot stop him, John. Besides, if they will not tell what they know, then they must pay the price.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill 'em aye, but not like this. 'Tain't Christian. Blood-curdling SCREAMS from behind the wagon where Aslan has dragged his victim. The Captain's face pales. Then silence. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The demented Arab slowly reappears. Blood drips from his lips. He munches the flesh from a long bone, on the end of which is the soldier's glove... the man's arm. Turning to Robin, Aslan shouts in Arabic and gesticulates wildly at the Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does he say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, roughly, he says that he doesn't care for the way your friend tastes, and he wants you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, God, no! I'll talk. Just keep him away. Keep him away! BEHIND WAGON Bull holds the other prisoner, muffling the man's mouth and trying to suppress his own laughter. Beside them lies a large chunk of venison. The man is unharmed, except that he's missing a glove. INT. WOODSMAN'S HUT - NIGHT The walls shake with Little John's laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure changed the color of 'is britches, didn't 'e?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks to our cannibal friend. Aslan repeats his wildman act, munching on a chunk of venison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gonna laugh my bloody balls off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd the Sheriff be sendin' gold north o' the border?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To hire mercenaries. The Celts are savage tribesmen, trained to kill from birth. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye, the Romans built a bleedin' great wall to keep 'em out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does 'e want wi 'em?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since he also has every Smith in the country working in his castle, we can assume he is planning a little war.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agin' who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: England. INT. CASTLE ARMORY - NIGHT Sparks. Smoke. Sweat. The Sheriff inspects his weapon factory. His eyes glint with the reflections of the smithy's fires. A DOOR CRASHES open behind him. FOOTSTEPS. Paying no heed, he draws a sword from a furnace. It's blade white- hot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were ambushed. In Sherwood Forest. Nottingham tests the sword against an anvil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spanish steel, cousin. So much stronger than our native blades. Any losses?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All the men are gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yet again you are the sole survivor, cousin? Interesting. And the gold?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it er... disappeared. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The Sheriff looks at Gisborne for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robin Hood?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were woodsmen, dressed in green.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robin Hood. He places a hand reassuringly on his cousin's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cousin, we must be strong. We cannot allow this outlaw to make fools of us. Without warning, he drives the blade into Gisborne's belly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I cannot allow a lieutenant to fail me. (turning to the horrified smithy) It is indeed fine steel. EXT. VILLAGE - DAY A small procession. Tuck drives his cart, Bull the tax wagon. Both vehicles laden with supplies. Wulf and Hal pass out flour, chickens, blankets, clothing to the villagers. Their weapons are prominently displayed. Tuck swigs from a jar, passes it to an old villager.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God bless you, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An' Go' bless Robin 'Ood, friar. They says as 'ow none o' the Sheriff's cronies dare go within miles o' Sherwood for fear o' havin' their pockets pinched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, the good Lord giveth and the good Lord taketh away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless Robin Hood takes it first! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Laughter. The procession passes two of the Sheriff's mounted soldiers. They glumly watch as Tuck raises his jug in greeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morrow, brothers. EXT. FOREST POOL - DAY Water, sparkling with sunlight. Bursts, as Robin dives in naked. He luxuriates in the cool water... HOOFBEATS. He attempts to hide... too late. Four horses emerge from the trees. Bull and Hal, with Marian and her servant Sarah sandwiched between them. Bull has a black eye. Marian jumps down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Robin) How dare you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning, Lady Marian. In response, she starts pelting him with stones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You send men to drag me from my home in the middle of the night, like some slave girl? Is this the way the famous Robin Hood treats a lady?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah well... er, let me finish this bath you wished me to take. Then I'll explain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I demand an explanation right now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you will be patient, I could spare your propriety by...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will decide when my propriety is compromised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you wish. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: He wades bare-ass naked out of the water towards her. She casts a contemptuous look over his muscled body, glistening with water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How dare you expose yourself to me?! She slugs him. Robin stumbles backwards into the water. Bull grins, gesturing to Sarah and pointing to his own black eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The big 'un did the same to me. EXT. WOODSMEN'S CAMP - DAY An arrow flies into a bull's-eye, crudely marked on a tree. Little John lowers his crossbow, delighted at his shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Wulf) Right m'lad. Let's see how close you can git to that bugger. Wulf takes aim. His arrow slices clear through his father's arrow, splitting it in two. Little John slaps Wulf on the back and beckons everyone over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a gander at this 'un, mates. Never seen nuthin' like it in my bloomin' life. Robin leads Marian through the camp... the beginnings of a village -- women doing laundry, kids playing, men prac- ticing archery and swordplay, others working on defenses, camouflaging a giant pit. Marian is impressed, but not about to admit it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This better be damned important. Robin leads her into a hut. Inside is a trove of cap- tured loot -- purses, jewelry, weaponry, fancy coats and... the treasure chest. At Robin's nod, Bull throws back the lid. Marian is speechless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nottingham robs the poor. We rob Nottingham and give back to the poor. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think he's going to let you get away with all this? The man is without mercy. He will annihilate you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody has to take a stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're taking a stand with the lives of these people. These young ones. A beat. She checks the faces. Her eyes meet Robin's. Is there a hint of concern for him also?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want from me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nottingham was sending this gold to buy reinforcements from the Celtic tribesmen. We need to warn King Richard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nottingham would not dare challenge the King.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The King is not in England to be challenged, is he? While he is away, he may lose his country. (Marian masks her concern) You are Richard's cousin. You can get word to him. He would believe you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you want me to participate in your folly? A little girl approaches, holding a bouquet of wild flowers. Touched, Marian kneels to accept the offering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Marian) I am sending Duncan with you. Give him some warm food and a real bed. I grow tired of his bellyaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hah! I have endured more hardship in my lifetime than any man here. Robin laughs and speaks to Marian in a stage whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell him I told you, but he may be useful to you. There is no one to whom I would rather entrust your safety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duncan, you are most welcome. Taking the lead rein from Duncan's horse, she rides away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calls after her) Will you send word to the King?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll think about it. INT. DUBOIS MANSION - DAY A globule of red liquid.    A signet ring.   Marian seals a letter. INT. BISHOP'S CASTLE - DAY The letter is held in the pudgy, jeweled fingers of the Bishop of Hereford. A lavish office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a personal matter, my Lord, but one of vital importance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand, my dear lady. This is my most trusted emissary. He hands the letter to a solemn courier. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will travel to France immediately. You must give this directly into the hands of the King, and him alone. The courier bows in acknowledgement.    Marian indicates Sarah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My lady-in-waiting will accompany you. Surprised, the courier glances at the Bishop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My dear, I could not vouch for her safety. The journey is fraught with danger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I appreciate your concern, my Lord, but Sarah is an accomplished rider. I must insist that she goes along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a beat) As you wish. EXT. WOODSMEN'S CAMP - DAY An informal council of war.   Robin uses a stick in the dirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to be ready to move camp at any time. The only way we can be attacked is from the Nottingham Road. We hide lookouts in the trees, here and here. If they see soldiers, they shoot warning arrows. Whistles by day, fire by night. Wulf runs up to Little John in panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father!   Come quick.   Mother's dying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. WOODSMEN'S HUT - DAY Fanny Little writhes in agony.    John rushes in.   Tuck looks up from Fanny's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The child comes early. Fanny screams.   John kneels beside her, taking her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hush, m'lass.    Ya'll be fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: not like t'others, John.    Oh God, it pains me so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (angrily, to Tuck) Ya're sittin' thar like a fat sow. Help her, man, help her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am doing all I can. Aslan appears in the doorway, with Robin. Whips back the blanket. Fanny's chest is covered with black squirming creatures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By Allah, leeches! He starts to pull the parasites off.    Tuck jumps at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get away from her! Aslan pushes him away, continuing his work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blood is like air. If she loses blood, she and the child will die. John is paralyzed with confusion.    Tuck appeals to Robin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lies. He is the devil's seed, sent to lead us astray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fool, both the Bible and the Koran instruct us to preserve life. Tuck raises an arm to strike Aslan. Robin blocks the blow. Aslan gently touches the mother's stomach. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (soothing) Your baby has not turned. It cannot be born without help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you know, you damned savage?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to John) If you will allow me, I can help her. It will not be without danger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do not listen to him!   He will kill her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you do not listen to me, she will certainly die. And the child, too. Fanny cries out.   John looks to Robin, pleading for advice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The good Friar has done all he can. I suggest you let the Arab try. (as John is undecided) If I am wrong, and they die, then you may take my life. John's eyes meet his wife's.   She nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So be it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then it will be on your head. I have warned you. He storms out.   All business, Aslan speaks to Wulf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring me a needle, thread, water, a skinning knife, and burning ashes. Wulf runs to obey. John looks horrified. Robin eases him outside, then returns to Aslan's side. They whisper. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you going to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The child must be taken out by the knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The knife?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have seen it many times with horses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Horses? By the Lord, what are her chances?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After wasting so much blood... not good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you tell me! Wulf runs back in.     Aslan holds up a piece of wood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Fanny) Are you ready?... Bite down on this... Robin, hold her steady. He lifts the red-hot knife from the ashes. OUTSIDE Little John paces. Wulf comes out of the hut.      Families hover and wait. From inside, MUFFLED GROANS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell you, the barbarian is killing her. John moves to the hut.     Wulf restrains him. INSIDE The mother heaves, then drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is she gone? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Aslan ignores him, keeps working over Fanny's body. Robin cannot watch... a WAIL! Aslan mutters something in awed Arabic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you say? Aslan holds up a bloody struggling infant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a boy. The mother revives.   Aslan places the child on her breast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your son, my lady... Robin, hold her skin together while I sew her up. He picks up the needle and thread.   Robin's eyes turn to the woman's abdomen... He faints.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This day God has taught me a fine lesson. He hands Aslan the knife and extends his bloodied wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would be honored. Aslan slices his own wrist. The two wrists clasp together in the universal sign of brotherhood. Everyone cheers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are a good man, my barbarian friend. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We shall open a barrel together and I shall do my damndest to save your heathen soul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alas, I am not permitted...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our God made this brew, brother. I merely combined the ingredients. Do you dare to insult his works? EXT. COUNTRY ROAD - DAY Hooves fly along a track. Sarah and the courier.    The courier reins in, Sarah draws alongside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My horse seems to be favoring a foreleg. Sarah leans down to look and the courier cudgels her across the neck. She falls from the saddle, unconscious. INT. DUBOIS MANSION - MARIAN'S CHAMBER - NIGHT Flickering candlelight. Marian is alone, reading. A sudden gust extinguishes her candle. HAMMERING and SHOUTING from a distant part of the house. Unnerved, she calls out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is there?     Duncan! INT. DUBOIS MANSION - KITCHEN - NIGHT Marian enters stealthily. A candle in one hand, a drawn dagger in the other. Something leaps at her!... A cat, looking for scraps on the kitchen table. She shoos him down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off, Nicodemus. Go find mice. She sighs with relief... is grabbed from behind.   A masked SOLDIER. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We meet again. He reveals a large scar on his wrist -- removes his mask -- the man who attacked her earlier. He prods her with his sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drop your blade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are still overmatched, soldier. She drops the sword. He hurls her against the table. Lays his blade against her chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You owe me favors, wench. Bare your breasts... or I will do it for you. Resignedly, she raises a hand to loosen the string on her dress. With the other hand she reaches behind her, grabs a pepper bowl. Flips the contents into his face. Screaming, he grabs his  face. She reaches for her dagger. He slashes with   his sword. She backs to the fireplace, grabs a spit  of roasted chickens... drives the point clean through  his chest. He stares in shock at his own blood pouring from the cooked fowls pinned to his breast... FOOTSTEPS... masked soldiers converge from both sides of the house, dragging the servants. Duncan  is shoved through the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am sorry, my lady.    There were too many. She stares at the invaders with studied calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there something you need, gentlemen? I remember no masked ball on my calendar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CASTLE CHAMBER - NIGHT The Sheriff and SIX BARONS are gathered around the model. These are the men who revealed their faces to Lord Locksley in the Druid ceremony. Nottingham toys with a white rat on his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget about Locksley. He is no threat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can we control all England if we cannot control our own county? The people are turning him into a hero.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is impossible to attack him in the forest. We have tried everything. He is cunning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we   will be more cunning. I must be   rid of him. We may not be able   to intercept his next warning   to the King. Sounds of COMMOTION outside. The door swings open. Framed in the doorway is a colossus in black armor. His helmet is the head of a dragon. He slowly raises the visor. Deep tribal scars on his cheeks. Implacable ferocity in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want the heads of the men who stole my gold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome, sir. We were discussing how to rid ourselves of those very men. The outlaws who band with Robin Hood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Lord Nottingham, I must protest. It is a mistake to ally ourselves with foreigners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can these Celts do that we cannot? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The Chieftain strides across to the fire. Grabs a burning log. The Baron backs away in fear. The log spits sparks as the Chieftain raises it above his head... and drives it into his own palm. He stares unblinking at the Baron, holding the log to his hand for a full three seconds. An awed silence. Nottingham grins, delighted with the demonstration. He deposits his white rat onto the model.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This rat Hood has hidden out in the forest.  He resists all our assaults with traps and devices, while he robs us blind. We must bring him out and destroy him. The rat has scurried into the shelter of the model trees. The Chieftain watches impassively, then calmly touches the log to the model. The trees ignite... the RAT SQUEALS in terror and runs. The Chieftain cuts off its escape, setting fire to more trees... again... and again. The Sheriff watches the flames, fascinated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, you son of Saladin. A toast to all of Jehovah's children. The saved and the damned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This must be a truly evil potion, to make the soul feel this good. He downs the entire jug in one long draught.   Refills it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, holy man. A toast to all of Allah's children. The true believers and the fat infidels. Tuck laughs and drinks. Aslan sways and topples at the Friar's feet. Heaves up all over the holy sandals. Tuck looks at Robin. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can these Arabs hold Jerusalem when they can't even hold their brew?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dancing demon! Good morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wincing) If it was Jehovah who created this brew, he is truly wise. He built the punishment into the crime. An ARROW WHISTLES into a tree.    Robin reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They need help. EXT. FOREST LANE - DAY Bull and Hal are crouched in the roadway, over a body. Robin runs up with Aslan. He kneels beside them. The body is Duncan. Robin clasps a dead hand... Silence. Fighting his emotions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bloke wearin' a mask o' the Druids rode by. Tossed 'im down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure it was a Druid mask? (as Bull nods) Damn them to hell! They must have Marian. Do you know where they meet? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Gregor Caves, I 'eard tell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We will go there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! You stay here, dammit!    I will go alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You forget yourself.   I am not your servant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then be my friend. There are women and children here in greater need of your courage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (considers) Take my eyes, then. He hands Robin his telescope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (under his breath) Marian! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: He runs forward. Turns the body over. Skin chalk-white from loss of blood... Sarah! A shadow falls across Robin. Before he can react, a cudgel stuns him into blackness. INT. CAVE - DAY Robin's eyes  -- he wakes. Squints around him, the dark smoke-filled  recesses of the caves. The walls weave. Eerie WATERY  sounds, like the CRIES of drowning men. He tries to  stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robin!... Robin! A figure in a flowing white robe. Angelic. Floating towards him... Marian. He tries to speak her name. Reaches out his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death is not to be feared, Robin. Embrace it. Her LAUGH ECHOES around the cave, as if hundreds of lost souls are laughing with her. Robin crawls away, cover- ing his ears. Marian lifts his face to hers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drink this. Weakly, Robin tries to push away the cup.   Her hand grips his chin, forcing his mouth open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drink. The liquid trickles over his lips. He tries to focus. Her features are BLURRED, her voice hypnotic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at me. Listen to me. You belong to me. Your soul is mine. You will obey my every word. Do you understand? Her face is inches from his. He tries to pull away, his subconscious sounding alarms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, Marian? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you love me. Say it. You love me. (as Robin struggles) Say it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sinking) I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kiss me. He gives himself to her. Their lips meet... something changes in his vision. Her eyes glow red. Her face starts to shrivel -- He is kissing the wrinkled lips of Mortianna. He pulls away... strong arms grab him. He shakes his head, trying to make sense. Through his BLURRED vision, we see he is surrounded by masked men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (slurred) Where is Marian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is with friends. (cackles) Your resistence is strong, but useless. Sign this. (as quill is forced into his hand) You are a Druid like your father. You consort with the devil. Your confession will be witnessed by the Bishop of Hereford. A guard forces Robin's hand across the page... then cries out, clutching his back... An arrow lodged be- tween his shoulders. In the cave mouth are Wulf, bow in hand, Bull kneeling beside Sarah's corpse, and Aslan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (horror) The painted man! Aslan's war CRY RICHOCHETS off the cave walls. A    curved scimitar in one hand, a straight English sword in   the other, his arms are lethal windmills. The masked    guards are cut down left and right. Mortianna retreats,    scurry- ing into the depths of the cave. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Bull joins the fray, charging like his namesake, howling in rage, flailing at heads with his quarterstaff. Wulf stays in the mouth, picking off men with deadly accuracy. A furious melee. Bull and Aslan mow down the enemy like hay, battling far superior odds. Soon they are the only two left standing. Bull peers cautiously into the dark- ness. Behind him, one of his victims crawls back to his feet... and lunges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind you! Too late. A sword is driven through Bull's gut. Aslan grabs the attacker by the neck and pile-drives him into the cave wall. The man's SKULL CRACKS against the rocks. Aslan runs to Robin's side, as Wulf hurries to Bull's. Robin is slumped against a rock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (groggy) Marian? Aslan runs to the back of the cave, searching. Wulf is crouched beside Bull, who murmurs his dying words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya be sure Sarah gits a Christian burial. Promise me, boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promise. Aslan stumbles at the edge of a deep crevasse. Far be- low he sees Mortianna, clambering down the steep rock. For a second their eyes meet. She hisses -- venom, hatred, fear -- then is gone. EXT. GREGOR CAVES - DAY Aslan carries Robin outside. Robin is staggering, glassy-eyed, mumbling incoherently. His arm blocks the light from his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have poisoned you. There are herbs that can alter a man's brain. I know of only one cure. He drops to one knee, slams Robin violently across the other. Slaps him on the back and forces his fingers down his throat. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It worked for me this very morning. (as Robin heaves) You will thank me for this later. EXT. COUNTRY LANE - DAY Distant THUNDER. Three horses. First Wulf's, leading another with the bodies of Bull and Sarah draped across its back. Aslan rides the third, with Robin propped up in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have fulfilled your vow.   Now you can leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your gratitude warms my heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ignored my request.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is fortunate that I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because of you, another good man is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He urged me to bring him. He was a brave man and I grieve for him. Praise be to Allah that I do not grieve for you also. Or for my broken vow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To hell with your damn vow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am glad you are feeling better. Ahead of them, Wulf shouts and reins in. He points into the distance. A huge cloud of smoke is darkening the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The forest!   Ride!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SHERWOOD FOREST - DAY Fire.   Blazing rampant. Along a hillside are hundreds of crossbowmen with fire arrows. At a shouted order, another wave of flaming arrows ignites the trees. Behind the crossbowmen are two figures on horseback. One is the Sheriff, in full armor. The other is the black-clad Celtic chieftain. He sits as still as a rock. EXT. WOODSMEN'S CAMP - DAY Chaos. Acrid black smoke pours across the clearing. Disarray. COUGHING, SCREAMING, confusion. Little John vainly attempts to instill calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya'll be jus' fine. Lil' smoke ain't gonna kill ya. Scared and injured woodsmen careen out of the trees. Full retreat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (running up) It's burning for miles, John. It's hotter than hades, and them damn screens ain't worth nothing. Two woodsmen, blinded and choking, stumble into one of their own camouflaged pits. Hideous screams as they're impaled on hidden stakes. John tries to gather the able- bodied men to his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Ere, lads... Over 'ere! We must make a stand. Most of them keep on running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn y'all! Ya're no more use than a load o' wet farts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's that damn Locksley?   I'll swear he betrayed us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bollocks, Will. Quit yer bloody bellyachin'. Hal runs to join them, stuttering. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... cccc...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... ccc? What the bloody hell ya sayin'? Cows?... Cowards?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cccc... elts!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Celts?   Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing behind him) Gggg... God help us. EXT. HILLSIDE - DAY Celts, arrayed behind their Chieftain. An awesome sight. Clad in hides and skins, painted arms and faces, head- pieces the faces of wild animals. Standing in eerie silence. A loud CLAP of THUNDER. Nottingham rides up to the Chieftain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want prisoners. The Chieftain does not turn his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We came to fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nevertheless, I need prisoners. With only a short flick of his head, the Chieftain spits. Nottingham waves his arm, signalling his own foot sol- diers to advance. The Chieftain raises his sword. Instantly a tumultuous chilling roar from his warriors. They charge forward. EXT. SHERWOOD FOREST - DAY The bloodcurdling cry fills the sky. Amidst the smoke and chaos, Little John's small band is gathered at the edge of the clearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are we gonna do, John? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop 'ere and flippin' well fight 'em, that's what. Whadya say, lads? Half-hearted support from about a dozen men, including Tack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nay, reveren'. Ya best be goin' wi' the wenches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This holy man believes in doing God's work with his hands. He snatches a quarterstaff.    John slaps him on the back. The men are encouraged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's give 'em a bloody good wallopin' an' all, lads. EXT. FOREST ROAD - DAY Aslan reins in. In the valley below, the forest is ablaze. The Sheriff's armed hordes swarm over the em- battled woodsmen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wulf, stay here. I need your horse. He climbs onto Wulf's horse, steers it right at the heart of the enemy... Aslan blocks his way, grabbing his reins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?    Out of my way!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saved your life. I will not let you give it away for no purpose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of my way, damn you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does the witch still have possession of your senses? If we meet up with the survivors we may yet give them some help. And do some damage to the enemy. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Robin debates.   Relents.   They urge their horses into a gallop. EXT. SHERWOOD FOREST - DAY The Sheriff's men stomp through the burning forest. From the other side of the flaming trees, Little John's men pick off shots with their longbows. They retreat, turn and fire again. They back into a clearing... The Celtic mercenaries charge at them across the open ground. The woodsmen drop their bows. Hand-to-hand combat. Woodsmen are being decimated. Little John storms and shouts, cutting down the enemy, inspiring his men. The Scotsmen are awed by this giant. Tuck is confronted by a wild-eyed Celt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surely you would not harm a man of the cloth? The man swings, Tuck sidesteps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You would?   Then to hellfire with you. He pummels the man to the ground with his staff. The woodsmen are broken into two groups. One group, including Will, is surrounded and surrenders. The others fight on. Bleeding from several wounds, Little John is surrounded by four Celts. He spins, challenging them, spitting out expletives. Defiant to the last... suddenly his attackers are hurled aside. Robin rides right through them, slashing with his sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Bout bleedin' time, mush. Tuck is driven to the ground... his assailant is deliver- ing the lethal blow, when Aslan cuts him down. Tuck glances heavenwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Lord. (an afterthought) And thank you, Allah. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Aslan is a   wild man. Steering his horse with just legs and knees,   he strikes out with both swords to left and right. The    momentum is turning. Wulf appears at the edge of the   clearing. Starts picking off stragglers. His father   spots him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Git the bleedin' 'ell outa there, ya li'l bugger. Distracted, he doesn't see a Celt swing at his back... but Wulf's arrow pierces the man's adam's apple. He freezes in mid-air, before toppling at John's feet. When John turns back, Wulf is being dragged away by three of the Sherrif's men. He attempts to pursue, but is intercepted by two more Celts... and struck down. Aslan charges between the two Celts. Slashes down with both swords. Both men topple to the ground simultaneously. Suddenly all is quiet.    The smoking clearing is a mass of fallen bodies. Only    four men seem to be alive. Robin, Aslan, Tuck, who   is slouched against a tree gasping for breath, and   Hal, who kneels clutching his wounded shoulder. Robin dismounts and runs to Little John. Overwhelmed and exhausted, he slumps over the giant's unmoving form.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't 'ee start bleedin' blubberin', or ya'll make me bloody vomit. Robin manages a relieved smile. Aslan strides over. All around them lie slain Celts and woodsmen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a fiendish mind that planned this campaign. EXT. SHERWOOD FOREST - DUSK A shovel breaks dirt. Beyond exhaustion, Robin digs a grave. The clearing is transformed into a cemetery. Tuck blesses the bodies of Bull and Sarah. Aslan drags a Celt's corpse into a grave. Throws the man's armor and weapons into a growing pile. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were an honor to your countrymen today, Aslan. You fought better than twenty English knights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This war is the God of Abraham against the forces of evil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, the war is over. He stares across the desolate clearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is too much blood on my hands. INT. CASTLE DUNGEONS - NIGHT A heavy key turns in a lock. Bolts drawn back. Fol- lowed by guards, Nottingham enters the torture chamber where the captured woodsmen are chained, among them Wulf and Will Scarlet. Putrid ankle-deep water on the floor, walls encrusted with dried blood and grime. Nottingham walks up to the FIRST MAN. Wry smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wry smile) Would you prefer pain or death?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death. Dignity masking his terror.    Nottingham appears to consider.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Torture him. The man is dragged away by guards.    The next PRISONER -- NOTTINGHAM And you?   Pain or death?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pure terror) ... Er... pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Torture him... you see, it makes no difference. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will all be tortured. You will all tell me all you know about Robin Hood, and then you will all be hanged. Then we will catch your beloved Robin Hood and do the same to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will kill him for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, no! Nottingham strides up to Will, drawing his sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would I need you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All your attempts to kill him have failed. Your army failed. Your Celtic mercenaries failed. Nottingham places his sword point against Will's throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you can succeed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am one of his men. He would never suspect me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knows you always hated him, traitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is a trusting fool. He will believe me. If he doesn't, he will kill me and you have lost nothing. Nottingham slides his blade between Will's teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you fail, I will personally cut out your lying tongue. He withdraws the blade.    Will tries to smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if I succeed? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His friends will.. (to a guard) ... torture him! He turns back to Will.   A smile of mock apology.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It will look better. EXT. SHERWOOD FOREST - NIGHT A winter's night. Bitterly    cold.  Sad figures huddled around a small fire. Fanny    tends to John's wounds, their little ones asleep by their   feet.  John drinks and passes the jug to Tuck, who numbly   shakes his head. Too depressed even to drink. Aslan folds his prayer rug and walks over to Robin, who sits alone, staring vacantly into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My pride brought us to this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, friend. It was you who gave these men pride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gave them nothing but false hope. Tomorrow we will disperse. These people can move south and start over. You must go home and win your Jasmina.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am no longer your responsibility.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is for me to decide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (raging) Damn you, Arab. I want you out of my life. Can't you understand that? Go home. Go back to your own kind. Aslan stares at him, then turns away. Not the time for argument. Robin fingers his father's medallion... rips it from his neck. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn you, too, Father.   You reared a coward and a fool. He hurls the medallion... it catches on a low-hanging branch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kiss me, Robin. The noose tightens on her neck. As she dies, her face shrivels into the cackling features of Mortianna. Next, Robin's father.   He stares accusingly right AT us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why have you betrayed me?   Why? Before he pulls the rope, the executioner peels back his hood... It is Robin. Gloating, he hauls on the rope. His laughter blends with that of Mortianna in a hideous cacophony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The first streaks of light fight their way through a thick, morning mist. Out of the mist steps a figure, at first indecipherable. Aware of his presence, Robin looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will!    I thought you were taken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you escape?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promised to kill you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And will you? Before Will can answer, Little John runs up.     Grabs Will's throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll wring yer scrawny neck, Will Scarlet. I'd be doin' yer a bloody favor an' all. Quickly, others arrive. Aslan, Tuck, Hal, Fanny, with kids clinging to her skirts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Afore ya kill 'im, John, ask 'im if Wulf be still alive. Will is choking, unable to speak. John loosens his hold just enough for Will to splutter out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Git us a rope, Hal, and we'll put the bleedin' weasel outa 'is misery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John, wait.    Let us hear what he has to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No bugger 'scapes the Sheriff, 'nless 'e's linin' 'is bloomin' pockets. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A traitor sneaks in and out under cover of darkness. Will walked in and announced himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dismissive) Aye.    'E always did 'ave balls o' brass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's sss... string 'im up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let him speak. John reluctantly moves his hold from Will's neck to his shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Search 'im, Hal. 'E'll 'ave a bloody blade on 'im somewheres. Will eyes the accusing faces. Hal searches, lifts Will's shirt. His whole skin is lacerated with deep gashes and fresh burns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bugger me. He steps back.    Ready to listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bring a message from Nottingham. Our men are to be hung in the square on Saturday. At high noon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about my boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy, too.    Ten men in all. Fanny drops her head on John's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their   deaths are a warning. Anyone   who associates with the outlaw   Hood is to suffer the same fate.    Man, woman, or child. Even anyone   who so much as utters his name. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robin Hood! Robin Hood! Robin Hood! (chuckles) May as well be hung for a sheep as a lamb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hangings are to be part of the celebration for the Sheriff's marriage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marriage, eh? What lucky wench gits to play with the Sheriff's codpiece? Will turns his gaze directly on Robin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lady Marian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes a bride of royal blood?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye, and then with King Richard gone, he takes the bloody throne. Everyone reacts with shock.     Only Robin appears unsur- prised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were to use this news to get close to me, and then kill me? Right, Will?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sly grin) Not straightway, of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is your intention, Will?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That depends on you, Locksley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never trusted you, that's no secret. What I wanna know is, are you gonna finish what you started? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Robin is on the spot.    All eyes on him.   Will presses his point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will ya stay and keep us fightin' till every man jack of us is dead? Or will you run like the spoiled little rich boy I always took you for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You present quite a choice.    What would you have me do, Will?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you run, I will kill you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if I stay, will you all stay with me? Robin checks the other faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the end, friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If my heathen brother stays, I stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmmm... meee... tttt... He can't get it out.    Little John covers Hal's mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'E's in. We're all bloody in. Daft buggers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's your answer, Will.    We finish it. EXT. NOTTINGHAM TOWN SQUARE - DUSK Ten gallows, silhouetted against the setting sun. The black-armored Celt tests a gallows, springing the hatch. A heavy sack dangles from the rope. Grim-faced peasants watch. Among  them -- Fanny Little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. DUNGEON - DUSK The sound of the gallows ECHOES inside the damp, stone walls. Wulf and the other woodsmen are chained to rings in the floor. Wulf lifts his eyes to a chink of light high in the wall. The purple sky is turning black. He fingers his wooden crucifix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it be your biddin' that this be my last night o' life, Lord, gimme the pluck to die proud. An' look 'ee kindly on my folks an' the young 'uns. The light in the cell melts to total darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A COCK ROBIN CHIRPS. EXT. SHERWOOD FOREST - DAWN In the troubled human realm, Tuck says his morning prayer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord, grant us the courage to endure, and if you're as smart as I believe you are, grant us victory... and the victuals to celebrate it with. Aslan is crushing charcoal into a mixture of yellow powder, which is turning black. Tuck approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you pray with me, son of Allah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have prayed for you, often, my brother. But, let us put prayer aside and help our gods in a more practical manner. I must reveal to you the mysteries of the black powder. Tuck takes a bowl of the powder close to the fire to examine it. Aslan snatches it back... Before Tuck can react, Robin walks up. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will it work? Aslan throws a handful of powder into the firel A fire- ball rips ten feet in the air... Tuck falls on his ass in terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (impressed) You are truly a wizard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is no such thing. But if there was... (chuckles) ... I would surely be one. Robin reaches out and shakes Aslan's hand. A moment of bonding. He moves on to the others, clasping each man's hand as he speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have no armored knights, no glorious banners. But I am honored to be going to battle in this company. Today we fight not just for the lives of our friends, but to save all England. A moment of tension before Will takes the proferred hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We may be only six men, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven! She strides towards them from the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What in blazes ya doin', woman? Where's the little 'uns?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Them's safe, wi' my mother. (pushes past Little John) Robin, I been to town an' seen the scaffold and the guard towers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya gone bleedin' cracked, girl? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You go an' birth eight babies and then you can come an' tell me 'bout hurtin', ya big ox. I ain't gonna sit aroun' an' let one o' 'em die, neither.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya should be bloody well mindin' the other seven. Tell 'er, Rob. Robin starts to draw a diagram on the ground with a stick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fanny, show me the exact location of the scaffold. Little John double-takes. EXT. NOTTINGHAM - DAY The gallows. Swathed in a pink glow. A brilliant, wintry morning. Breath billows from the mouths of the sentries. INT. NOTTINGHAM CASTLE - CORRIDOR - DAY Boots clack confidently down a stone corridor. The Sheriff decked in wedding finery. He enters... INT. CASTLE CHAMBER - DAY ... Mortianna's apothecary. Dark, smoke-filled. Foul things in jars. Animals in cages, waiting to meet unspeakable ends. Marian is strapped in a chair, flanked by two armed guards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How is my bride? Marian smiles as he leans toward her... and spits in his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah... You are overwhelmed with happiness. He slowly wipes off the spittle... and slaps her hard. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calm, uncowed) I will never marry you. Mortianna emerges from a dark corner, bearing the goblet she used at the Druid ceremony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold her! Marian struggles against her bonds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get away from me, you disgusting hag. I will not... augh! The guards viciously restrain her, forcing her mouth open. Mortianna pours the blood-red liquid down her throat. Marian fights, gagging and choking... until the drug takes its effect. She slumps forward. Nottingham watches with amusement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Mortianna) When we are married, thirty of the northern barons will pledge me their support as king. As you predicted. Mortianna squats on the floor besides a platter of blood. Clasps the dice-like runes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you see in the portents? Mortianna rocks on her heels, clutching her taloned hands to her sides. She chants, fingering the bloody stones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The union. The blood of the lion and the house of Nottingham. New faith. New power. New souls. She stares at Nottingham, her red eyes demented.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there is no union, there will be darkness, despair, death. Ours!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Di not give me riddles, woman. We are to be married within hours. How can we be in danger? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction
